Name:
USS Macomb
JDS Hatakaze
ROCS Hsien Yang[1]
Namesake: William H. and David B. Macomb
Fate:
Transferred to Japan,
19 October 1954

Returned to U.S., 1969; sold to Republic of China, 1970
Cannibalized for spare parts.
Stricken:
1 February 1970
Converted to dockside training ship[2]
Armament:
4 × 5 in (127 mm) DP guns,
5 × 40 mm AA guns,
5 × 20 mm AA guns,
5 × 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes,
6 × depth charge projectors,
2 × depth charge tracks
